turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: There's a guy in here, hurt bad! We gotta get him to a doctor!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: He might have fallen down the stairs, I don't know, I don't know what's going on, I'm confused. I have this memory thing - do I know you?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: No. Don't worry, I'm a cop. Everything'll be okay. Is he still breathing?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Maybe. Maybe just.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't know. See, I have this condition.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Well, I hope it's not as serious as his, 'cos this guy's dead.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: This is a drug deal?!

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: That, and your thing.						   *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: He knew about Sammy. Why would I tell him about Sammy?							  *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You tell everyone about Sammy. Everyone who'll listen. "Remember Sammy Jankis, remember Sammy Jankis". Great story. Gets better every time you tell it. So you lie to yourself to be happy. Nothing wrong with that - we all do. Who cares if there's a few little things you'd rather not remember?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I dunno... your wife surviving the assault... her not believing about your condition... the doubt tearing her up inside.., the insulin -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: That's Sammy, not me! I told you about Sammy -

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Like you've told yourself. Over and over. Conditioning yourself to believe. "learning through repetition" -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Sammy let his wife kill herself! Sammy ended up in an institution - !				    *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Sammy was a con man. A faker.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I never said he was faking! I never said that!

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You exposed him for what he was: a fraud.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I was wrong! That's the whole point! Sammy's wife came to me and -

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Sammy didn't have a wife.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My wife wasn't diabetic.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: She wasn't diabetic. You think I don't			 * know my own wife? What the fuck is wrong		    * with you?							*

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I guess I can only make you believe the things you want to be true, huh? Like ol'		   * Jimmy down there.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: But he's not the right guy!					  *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: What difference does it make whether he			* was your guy or not?						    *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It makes all the difference.					 *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Why? You're never going to know.				  *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes, I will.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: No, you won't.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Somehow, I'll know!

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You won't remember!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: When it's done, I'll know! It'll be different!

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I thought so too! I was sure you'd				* remember. But you didn't.					    *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You know, when we found your guy and			   * killed him.  That's right, the real John G. Over a			  * year ago. I helped you find him. He's			  * already dead.							 *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why do you keep lying to me?					 *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I'm not. I was the cop assigned to your			* wife's death. I believed you, I thought			* you deserved the chance for revenge. I helped you find the other guy who was in your bathroom that night. The guy who cracked your skull and fucked your wife.		    * We found him and you killed him.				  *   MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99 115A.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: So who are you saying he was?					*

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Just some guy. Does it even matter who? I stopped asking myself why a long time ago. No reason, no conspiracy; just bad fucking luck. A couple of junkies, too			 * strung out to realize that your wife didn't live alone. When you killed him,			* I've never seen you so happy - I was convinced you'd remember. But it didn't stick, like nothing ever sticks. Like this won't stick.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You probably.							 *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: No. You took them out.						  *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why would I do that?						    *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: To set yourself a puzzle you won't ever solve. You know how many towns, how many		    * guys called James G? Or John G? Shit, Leonard, I'm a John G.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Your name's Teddy.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: My mother calls me Teddy. I'm John Edward Gammell. Cheer up, there's a lot of John		    * G's for us to find. All you do is moan.			* I'm the one that has to live with what			 * you've done. I'm the one that has to put		    * it all together. You just wander around			* playing detective. You're living a dream,		   * kid. A dead wife to pine for and a sense		    * of purpose to your life. A romantic quest		   * which you wouldn't end even if I wasn't			* in the picture.							    *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I should kill you.							 *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Quit it!							 * 					   * You're not a killer, Lenny. That's why			 * you're so good at it.						   *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It is now.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You can't just take it!

turns.speaker: LEONARD							  *
turns.text: Okay. We clean him up, untie him and			   * march him out with a gun in his back.			  *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Why would I have a gun?

turns.speaker: LEONARD							  *
turns.text: What cop?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: This bad cop. He checked you into the			  * Discount Inn. Then he's been calling you		    * for days, sticking envelopes under your			* door, telling you shit.						 *

turns.speaker: LEONARD							  *
turns.text: Bullshit.							*

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: His name's James F. Grantz, John G. Check		   * your tattoos.							 *

turns.speaker: LEONARD							  *
turns.text: What was it for?							   *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: A load of amphetamine I told him I had.

turns.speaker: LEONARD							  *
turns.text: * Thank you.							    *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Fuck you; I gave you a reason to live and		   * you were more than happy to help. You lie		   * to yourself! You don't want the truth,			 * the truth is a fucking coward. So you			  * make up your own truth.						 *

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Gin and Tonic.  Plymouth or Boodles.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Lemon or lime?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Lemon doesn't go in Gin and Tonics, darlin'.  Where ya' from?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Gottingen.  That's in Sweden.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You in Miami workin' on your complexion...?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: No.  I was in Namibia...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Doing...?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: With the United Nations High Commission on Refugees.  Famine relief.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: What's your twenty?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Quarter mile away.  We see the lights...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Turn around.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: We know these people...!

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Grieve elsewhere.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: About the Stevens family, I'm sorry.  I know you were close to them.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I was the kids' godfather.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: And...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: "And" what?

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: I got to know.  There is never any room for "personal"...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Sal Maguda.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: He any good?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Oh, yeah...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: So what's gonna persuade Montoya to change off Sal Maguda running his deliveries...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: With Sonny.  110%.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Then that's it.  Change the mission statement. Crockett stays in.  He keeps working up the ladder.  The local importers get a pass for the time being.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: They'll kill Gina.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: They may have already, so we protect the living.  Proof she's alive?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: She's sending a message.  Meth Lab. Trailer park.  Anything with interesting antenna arrays...?

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: There's three between Miami International and the glades.  I'm gonna try for her, but this is triage.  Protect the maximum number of lives.  You need to know that...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: ...eliminated one.  SWAT's on the next two...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Trudy and I are goin' for Gina...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: ...I didn't want you around the crime scene because it's crawling with federal law enforcement.  We don't know who's straight up, who's not...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Recruit us to do what?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: He is fine.  And we know the jokes. When it gets vengeful, things get messy.  When they get messy the wrong people die...  Everybody gets it.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Okay.  What'd you spot...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Three wakes off the back of those boats.  Who runs three Sterling engines off a deep-V hull?

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: José Yero changed-up the drop plan on us.  He's grabbed Gina.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Where's the new drop point...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: They'll have surveillance on us. We'll know only at the last moment...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: It's a rip and a hit.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Get me Air Support...  We'll be airborne and assault the ambush...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You can't.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Just came in.  She's still alive.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Safe house is empty...  Air Support's set to jump when we know your drop point.  Gina?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: We're not certain...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: You said Nazi Low-riders...?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: We're not certain!

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Not anymore.  This is a distribution network out of South Florida, moving poly-drug loads, crystal meth through coke, to Nashville, Atlanta, Memphis, Cleveland.  And computer fraud, identity theft. It's like that.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Tell them what you want.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: They knew about Alonzo, <u>before</u> he made a move on them.  They had our operation.  They've cut into us.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: You need to consider a few issues.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: ...you'd be operating outside territorial United States.  Your badges do not count.  You have no authorization to carry weapons.  If you're busted, it could take a long time to get you re-patriated.  And there's no backup...  And you will share with them all your intel on Montoya...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: I mean <u>full</u> disclosure.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Of course.  From my side, I don't WANT to know anything about what you're doing or how you do it...  So let me know if we're on...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: Yes you do...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: I got to talk to my ADO...

turns.speaker: CASTILLO
turns.text: No, you don't, Jim.  'Cause if I close this down, you got nothing to make a phone call about.  And my guys don't have a week for a Feeb bureaucratic process.  Every hour longer they're in there, they risk exposure.  So, right here, right now, they're back in or I pull them out and close you down.  What's it going to be?

turns.speaker: EL TIBURON
turns.text: Meth precursors and the Dutch party favors are en route.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: All I want to know is the where and the when.  Spare me mini moves, progress reports and bullshit.

turns.speaker: EL TIBURON
turns.text: Okay.  You got the "item"?

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: I got the item.

turns.speaker: EL TIBURON
turns.text: And our friend don't like the rest of the people bringin' the merch to you.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: EL TIBURON
turns.text: Two main players plus three.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: My end?

turns.speaker: EL TIBURON
turns.text: 25% discount on the load.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: Make it 40%.

turns.speaker: EL TIBURON
turns.text: Make it 35.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Put your guns on the table...  If we wanted you dead, you would no longer be drawing breath in Miami. We wouldn't have brought you all the way here.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Really?  So, what is this, a party?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I thought we had to meet the Man.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: You do.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Right now.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: We want it back.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What's the recovery?  How much are you looking for?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What's "nothing"?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Nothing.  As in "free, gratis."

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: There is one thing you can do for me in recognition of the death- defying risks we took to recover your product...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: And what is that?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What do you like to drink?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I'm a fiend for mojitas.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: How fast does that go?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: It goes very fast.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Show me...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: So where's the best place for mojitas?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Bodeguita del Medio.  It's the <u>only</u> place for mojitas...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Where's that?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Off a little alley with cobblestones.  Hemingway went there...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: The Keys?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Havana.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Havana?  Cubans don't like us or my business...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Are you afraid?  Good.  And you don't need a visa. Cause you're with me.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: My cousin is the harbor master. You must not bring in drugs.  You cannot be armed.  If you're carrying, it has to go.  Or stow it inside.  No one will go near your boat...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You do business in Cuba with your husband?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I never do business in Cuba.  And nobody goes to Cuba but me.  And he is not my husband...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Were you born in Havana?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Angola.  My mother was being a surgeon there.  She volunteered. Mozambique and Mali, too...  ...those days, in those days...she was part of Cuba's gift to the third world.  She came from a bourgeois family with a house in Verdado...we still have the house. We will go there...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Where's she now?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: She's dead...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Your father?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Angolan Military.  Went back to the fighting.  Disappeared.  Who knows...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How's he not your husband?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I am no one's wife.  I live in my own house.  I do not live in a man's house.  He has a wife.  We are together.  I am free.  Because of banking and finance and travel...  And I can do anything I want...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Mojitas...?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Later!  Do you dance?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I dance...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Tell <u>me</u> everything.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I insist.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Okay.  Macon, Georgia is where I was born. Wound up in a juvenile facility.  I was 14.  Then the military.  Then prison.  Because I was dumb and angry.  Then I read.  Then I got smart.  Then I discovered what I know, now...it's all business...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Blanca...a rubio like you.  I see her in a dress...an old photograph from Lucinda somebody's wedding...everybody is with couples.  Husbands and wives.  They all pose.  My mother is alone because my father had to go back to the fighting.  ...she looks right into the camera. She is the most beautiful woman in the room.  By herself.  In a party dress.  And she looked like she knew she would die alone...  She spoke many languages.  We were in Luanda when she died.  I went to her friends in Mali.  They sent me to the Ecole Polytechnique in Geneva to study mathematics, where I met Montoya in the discos.  He had banking there...I was seventeen and very much into the clubs.  And he sent me to University for an MBA in Finance.  Your mother?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Died in childbirth, having me...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: To mothers.  And all that we owe them...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You know how improbable this is...?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: "Probable"...applies to an event that may be real.  Doesn't apply here.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: ...'cause we have no future...are of today and not tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: ...and therafore there is no consequence?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Like...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Like "three thousand a ki?"  That's nice. And I can supply the transportation into South Florida and the Gulf, more reliable and on-time than FedEx.  But, three per ki was OK for openers.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: And why should continuing excellence cost more?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Cost less.  That's the point.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Is it December?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Did Christmas come early this year...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Better than that.  We become partners.  Only in this territory and only on loads we run. And you don't pay us three thousand a ki.  You pay us zero.  Why we get is thirty percent of the load. Product or cash.  "And why," you're thinking, "would I be crazy enough to out in these gringos like that? Is he chipping?  Crazy for my love? Too many mojitas?"  And the answer is, "of course" but also "no.  It is because Sonny can deliver what no one else can."

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Good samba dancing...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Zero risk.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: 'Cause you don't lose loads?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: 'Cause we <u>guarantee</u> every load.  Anywhere, for any reason, it comes up short, we make good.  Your operations will, from now on, run risk-free.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: And you're our thirty-percent partner?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: The range should be between fifteen and seventeen-point-five percent of the P.O.E....to even consider it.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I need thirty.  Calculate in, also, the cash you don't have to front...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Available cash is not an issue for us...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Twenty-eight-point-five.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What if I pushed to twenty-one...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I would say you're...  ...four percentage points away from a deal...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Maybe I'm only one.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Hola, chica.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Hola, viejo.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I forgot the napkins.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: And the chopsticks and fortune cookies?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What's the best fortune you ever got?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: They're all the same.  "Financial security is around the corner." "Your friends love you."

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: In Kowloon, once, I got one that said, "Live now because life is dust."

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Do you have assets somewhere else? Bank accounts?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: ...to fall back on.  You know, a fail-safe.  Insurance.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Do I need it?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Everybody needs it.  Ask Prudential.  Or Allstate.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: 'Cause whatever can go wrong, will...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Something like that.  The odds catch up with you.  The odds are like gravity.  You can't negotiate with them.  So...at some point, you should cash out, take your money and run...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Sure.  As far away and as fast as you can.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Whenever.  Maybe later, maybe sooner.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Would you find me...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Where would I go?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Zanzibar.  The Comoros Islands. Somewhere in the Indian Ocean. There's twelve-hundred islands there...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Is this the protective male talk?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: This is the talk of a man...if he were your husband...he would never put you at risk.  He would never put you within a thousand miles of anything that could hurt you.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: And if I were in the Comoros, in the Indian Ocean, where would you be...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: A few more moments, still in this business.  Then I'd find you.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Would you?  Because if you couldn't, I would be very lonely... I would have left the only world I know and have known since I was seventeen.  But none of this will happen.  So it doesn't matter.  Because we are on the Guajira Peninsula.  And all you see around you...look around... is Archangel de Jesus Montoya- Londono.  He is my man.  And you are a smuggler moving a load...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: ...in the morning.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I'll be on board by noon.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Yero, by himself?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Maybe.  Maybe with the crazy whites.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: If they attack you...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: ...it's gonna be an L-shaped ambush.  They're not gonna open up until they got the party favors, 'cause all they'd get is a lot of police scrambling to a gunfight. They <u>will</u> wait till they got the goods before they do the deed.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What are you going to do with me? Are you taking me to jail?  You think I will turn into your informant, is that it?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: No part of it wasn't real.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I know.  And now?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: It still is.  I'm so in this, I don't know which way is up... All I know is I won't let anything bad happen to you.  Just like I said.  And I know we can't ever see each other again.  And we never will.

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: José...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Sonny Burnett...this is my partner, Rico.

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Sit.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Who you run loads for?  Cause other than Nicholas, you knows you?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: You afraid of violence?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I am not John Wayne.  There is no "S" on his chest.  We get down if the play calls for it.  But we are into business and making money.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Red light, green light, José?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: I'm also called "Cochi Loco."  That means "Crazy pig."  'Cause I enforce security and get people to tell me what I need to know.  That part of what I do, you never want to find out about.  Other people will negotiate the money and go or not go.  Not me...

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Client got delivery.  But there were..."extras" in the back of the truck.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: "Extras" tried to relieve us of your weight...  And by the by, you know of a player in Overtown who goes by the name of "Things Aquatic"?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: I do.  We don't do business with him...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: He tried to..."do business"...with you.  Around ten.  His place.  Be there.

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: I'll be there.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: And what do I do with him?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How 'bout this?  How'd Neptune know where to hit us?  Huh?  Whose Op sec's got a leak?  Yours?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: What'd Neptune tell you?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: He didn't.  Interrogation's not in our skill set.  So c'mon, what suspicions have you master-minded off these associations?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Here's what this is...ask how much they want to turn back to us our load...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Packaging?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Fifty-gallon drums.  Thirty-two.  A hundred kilos in each.  You transship that to the Malaysian boat.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Hey, Captain Kirk.  I think maybe I have second thoughts.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You got something to say, José, let's hear it.

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: I confess I have succumbed to my weaknesses.  An inability to see another's point of view.  I've discussed it with professionals.  Even with one of your friends.  She's here now...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: What friend?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Mrs. Rico.  But don't worry.  She is safe.  To insure that, I am keeping her close to me.  It's always good to keep people your friends care about close to you.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Proof of life.  How do I know Mrs. Rico's alive?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: 'Cause she will tell you.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: What's our deal?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Backup in case the Russians get physical.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How lucky's Miss Universe gotta be?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Skin has to touch skin.  That's the requirement for the warrant.  Then he makes a credible excuse and he stops....  Her crew blackmailed and asset- stripped the last mark down to his social security...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And there's Dmitri...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: The honey trap.  And there's the honey.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Hello, Miss Ukraine...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Alonzo...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Stevens?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Something's wrong.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: White gangs...?  It doesn't track.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: White gangs is tweakers and a crystal meth lab in a trailer park. Bounce around the old lady Saturday night and get your recidivist ass busted back...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Aryan brothers are not going to change-up suppliers.  So...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Transpo?  How they bringing the loads in...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Track with me, here...  They knew the "Russians" were undercover Feeb?  They should have no-showed.  But, no, these guys show anyway, and commit murder upon federal officers.  And steal all your money...  What does that say to you?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: It says, "We do not fear you."  It says, "Fuck off and die."  It says, "We get down for recreation..."

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: We could try to run loads into these guys.  Run a few loads for Montoya into South Florida.  Into this group.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And we didn't come down here to audition.  Business auditions for us...  ...and know who we are and know they want their load run by us <u>before</u> Nicholas calls.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: That way we do not waste AvGas or our motherfucking time.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: People gonna walk into this place and say, "Ola, hijo!  That some crazy wallpaper.  Whew...it wild! Is that a Jackson Pollack?"

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: "No, viejo.  That was José Yero, splattered all over his motherfucking wall."

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: So we can close each other's eyes right now.  Real easy.  Real fast.  But, then, nobody makes any money...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: And specialize in very fast go-fast boats for coastal runs.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What kind of weight?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: The people on shore who handle a load we run are our people, not your people.  No tweakers, dopers, first- timers we don't know.  They didn't do time with us, they ain't doing crime with us.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What <u>you</u> get <u>from</u> us is a date.  A place.  "In the parking lot of a Jack-in-the-Box in north Miami."  At such-and-such time, an eighteen- wheeler will be there.  Keys in the ignition.  Ready to roll.  You pick it up.  And you drive it...  ...away.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Money thing is done in advance in places where there are no guns. Because when money and guns get together, there is violence...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Then it don't work.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What happened to the last transporter you <u>had</u>?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Where we meeting 'em...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Port-Au-Prince.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: What do we got?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Five minutes...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: They watching us watching them watching us waiting for them?  Or what?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Who knows...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: To the limit.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You worried about the tree line, US Customs AWACS, or something else on your mind?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Like...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Gina in the Miami pad.  You gonna give me phony denials?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: No.  You gonna give me phony reassurances?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Good.  So let's go...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: How much we looking for?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Where the hell are you, man?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: On my way back...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Where'd you go?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Hit a couple of jazz clubs.  Fell back to her place.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Verdado.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Verdado where?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: It's in the suburbs outside Havana.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Havana, Cuba...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: No.  Havana, Louisiana.  Don't we have a meet?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: ...where you're makin' a move on the wife of Archangel de Jesus Montoya?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You're not makin' a move on her...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: We're makin' moves on each other.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Oh, that makes it okay, then.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Yeah.  CIA-level stuff...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And what does that level of spending on first-class, private- sector infrastructure signify to you?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Mega-tonnage and mega-cash flow...
